thread.title: Moussa Dembele to Arsenal, Ashley Young to China and Fabinho to Manchester United: Ten hottest transfers that could happen this summer
thread.title_full: Moussa Dembele to Arsenal, Ashley Young to China and Fabinho to Manchester United: Ten hottest transfers that could happen this summer

author: ashilton
title: Moussa Dembele to Arsenal, Ashley Young to China and Fabinho to Manchester United: Ten hottest transfers that could happen this summer
text:
EFL FOOTBALL WHISPERS Moussa Dembele to Arsenal, Ashley Young to China and Fabinho to Manchester United: Ten hottest transfers that could happen this summer 
Football Whispers takes you through the likely deals Feature By Chris Bailey, Football Whispers 13th February 2017, 2:52 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments MEMORIES of the January transfer window may be fading into the distance but clubs are already busy plotting big money moves for the summer. 
Football Whispers cut the wheat from the chaff when it comes to transfer stories as their unique algorithm rates each rumour out of five for validity. News Group Newspapers Ltd Moussa Dembele is wanted by a number of Premier League giants 
Get ahead of the game and learn the TOP TEN hottest whispers right now … 1. Moussa Dembele – Celtic to Arsenal – 3.8 
Whether Arsene Wenger quits in the summer or not, Arsenal will likely continue their love affair with young, pacy Frenchmen long into the future – and Moussa Dembele certainly fits the bill. 
Chelsea were rumoured to be weighing up a £40million deal for the 20-year-old , but Arsenal are now thought to be leading the race for a man who has scored hat-tricks in successive games for Celtic. Moussa Dembele shows Chelsea what they’re missing after firing deadly 24-minute hat-trick against St Johnstone Football Whispers' top ten rated deals to happen this summer 2. Ashley Young – Manchester United to Shandong Luneng – 3.7 
A rumour that has persisted for a while now, but all signs point to Ashley Young ’s exit from Manchester United in the summer and a possible money-spinning deal in China. 
The former England winger has featured just twice for United since December 14 and though Jose Mourinho was reluctant to let him go in January, the writing is surely on the wall. Getty Images Ashley Young has been offered mega money to move to China 3. Fabinho – AS Monaco to Manchester United – 3.6 
According to Fabinho’s Dad, Joao, every man and his dog are interested in the Monaco star but we like the chances of a transfer to United the best. 
However, Arsenal, Manchester City and even Barcelona could still pip Mourinho to Fabinho, who since being converted from a right-back last season has been a revelation in the Monaco midfield. Getty Images Monaco's Fabinho is on the radar of Jose Mourinho at Man Utd 4. Antoine Griezmann – Atletico Madrid to Manchester United – 3.5 
This whisper is not disappearing anytime soon, and the latest rumour is that Antoine Griezmann will still be willing to join United, and his good mate Paul Pogba, even if they miss out on the Champions League. 
Atleti president Enrique Cerezo has dismissed reports that the 25-year-old, who scored his 17th goal of the season on the weekend, will leave, but he has an £85million release clause just begging to be activated. Getty Images Antoine Griezmann is another target of Jose Mourinho's at Old Trafford 10 things you may not know about French striker and Manchester United target Antoine Griezmann 5. David De Gea – Manchester United to Real Madrid – 3.5 
Few United fans will bat an eyelid if Young leaves – but many will be left wiping their eyes if Real Madrid sign star keeper David De Gea at the second attempt. 
A transfer only thwarted by a dodgy fax machine 18 months ago, the Spanish giants never rest until they get their man, but expect fierce resistance from Old Trafford. PA:Press Association But Man Utd could lose David de Gea if Real Madrid get their way Manchester United keeper David De Gea pull off a world class save against Watford Related stories PEP TALK Pep Guardiola makes heartwarming gesture to Harry Arter by wishing him well for upcoming birth of child PREVIEW PSG v Barcelona: What time does the match kick-off, what TV channel is it on, and what is the latest team news? TV TIMES Benfica v Borussia Dortmund: What TV channel is it on and what is the latest team news? TEAM NEWS PSG vs Barcelona: Javier Pastore looks to be doubtful whilst Catalans set to play full-strength side TEAM NEWS Benfica vs Borussia Dortmund: Mario Gotze doubtful as German side sweat on several key players KO BLOW The Champions League is back and our experts make their picks... but it's not good news for the English contingent LOTHAR'S LOWDOWN Gabriel Jesus can be quick off the mark for Man City as they prepare for a Champions League assault my own master New Striker: Has Nick made a new enemy in Hong Kong? TEAM TERRY John Terry shares second clip of family keepie-uppies after horror ankle gash ruled him out of Burnley draw French exam Barcelona prepare for Paris Saint-Germain test as they train at Parc des Princes ahead of blockbuster Champions League last 16 showdown TU CAN PLAY THAT GAME Borussia Dortmund boss Thomas Tuchel searching for consistency as his side head to Benfica IT's SUNREAL Sutton defender Simon Downer ready to shoot down Arsenal in FA Cup as stocky stopper takes aim at team-mates DAVE KIDD Premier League clubs need a reality to check to show just how far they have fallen behind their European rivals 'It's awful' Aston Villa boss Steve Bruce has blasted his side's form as they lose at home to Ipswich Town on the weekend PREMIER TABLE Leaders Chelsea drop points, Arsenal climb to third and Man City close the gap on top spot TON TWINS Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi return to the Champions League eyeing a century of goals 'Would be a dream' Manchester City star Sergio Aguero revealed that Liverpool were the club he was wishing to play for STERLING JOB Bournemouth 0 Man City 2: Raheem Sterling and Sergio Aguero fire Pep Guardiola's side eight points behind leaders Chelsea in title race CITY HEAD SOUTH LIVE - Bournemouth 0 Man City 2: Sergio Aguero doubles City's lead as they close in on leaders Chelsea TEAM NEWS Bournemouth vs Manchester City: Sergio Aguero and Claudio Bravo could both be benched again for the visitors 6. Inaki Williams – Athletic Bilbao to Liverpool – 3.3 
According to some reports, Liverpool are willing to activate a release clause and shell out a whopping £42.5million for Athletic Bilbao forward Inaki Williams. 
The 22-year-old has recently denied he is looking for a ‘change of scenery’ – but the prospect of playing at Anfield week in, week out could well help the one-cap Spain international reconsider. EPA Liverpool are likely to face competition from Dortmund for Inaki Williams 7. Leonardo Ulloa – Leicester City to Sunderland – 2.9 
Despite throwing every one of his toys out of the pram in January – not to mention his agent – Leonardo Ulloa was forced to remain in the East Midlands. 
Sunderland reportedly made bids ranging from £3million to £11million for the Argentinean last month, but a move in the summer is dependent on whether either, or both clubs, can beat the drop. PA:Press Association Argentina hitman Leonardo Ulloa wants out of Leicester 8. Ghayas Zahid – Valerenga to Manchester City – 2.9 
This rumour came from the horse’s mouth as Norwegian youngster Ghayas Zahid claimed he was close to leaving Valerenga for Manchester City during the January transfer window. 
If he does make his mooted switch in the summer, however, expect him to gain experience at sister clubs Melbourne City or New York City, rather than take the Etihad by storm next year. Getty Images Ghayas Zahid (far right) could be on his way to Manchester City 9. Dele Alli – Tottenham Hotspur to Manchester City – 2.5 
Sorry, Ghayas – but this move would steal your thunder if it went through this summer. Rumours are gathering pace that City will pull out all the stops to extract Dele Alli from White Hart Lane. 
Pep Guardiola has seen the boy wonder score twice against his team this season and he has apparently instructed the powers-that-be to make a world-record bid. Getty Images 11 Dele Alli could end up replacing Yaya Toure at Manchester City Dele Alli is on top form in this new adidas advert that just won't let you forget his name 10. Michael Keane – Burnley to Chelsea – 2.4 
Michael Keane put in a mammoth performance to help stop Chelsea going 12 points clear at the top of the Premier League on Sunday. 
That will only have reinforced Antonio Conte’s opinion of the Burnley defender, who started his career at Old Trafford, as he seeks a replacement for John Terry in the summer. Reuters Michael Keane did a fine job of shackling Diego Costa on Sunday Who is better at indoor kick-ups? Ryan Giggs or Michael Keane
